Docs.param: The entire query or the class name to use in the query. The parser in this class attempts to parse the string as a valid WQL SELECT query. If the parser is unsuccessful, it assumes the string is a class name.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified query or the specified class name.

## Remarks

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ClassName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ClassName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the class name to be selected from in the query.
Docs.value: Returns a value containing the name of the class in the query.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new class name.
A value for the **ClassName** property would replace the \<className> item in a SELECT query of the form "SELECT * FROM \<className> WHERE \<condition>".
## Property Value A string representing the name of the class in the query.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
## Examples The following example initializes a <xref:System.Management.SelectQuery> by specifying a query and then changes the <xref:System.Management.SelectQuery.ClassName%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Condition { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Condition : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the condition to be applied in the SELECT query.
Docs.value: Returns a value containing the condition to be applied to the SELECT query.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new condition.
A value for the **Condition** property would replace the \<condition> item in a SELECT query of the form "SELECT * FROM \<className> WHERE \<condition>".
## Property Value A string containing the condition to be applied in the SELECT query.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsSchemaQuery { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IsSchemaQuery : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this query is a schema query or an instances query.
Docs.value: Returns a value indicating whether the query is a schema query.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new query type.
## Property Value `true` if this query should be evaluated over the schema; `false` if the query should be evaluated over instances.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

Public Overrides Property QueryString As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ QueryString { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.QueryString : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the query in the object, in string form.
Docs.value: Returns a value containing the query.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. In addition, setting this property causes the other members of the object to be updated when the string is reparsed.
## Property Value A string representing the query.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Collections::Specialized::StringCollection ^ SelectedProperties { System::Collections::Specialized::StringCollection ^ get(); void set(System::Collections::Specialized::StringCollection ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Ggets or sets an array of property names to be selected in the query.
Docs.value: Returns a containing the names of the properties to be selected in the query.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new properties.
A value for the **SelectedProperties** property would replace the \<property> item in a SELECT query of the form "SELECT \<property> FROM \<className> WHERE \<condition>".
## Property Value A <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection> containing the names of the properties to be selected in the query.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
